text: happiness is uh typically defined by

subjective well-being uh and sometimes

all three of those aspects are in the

and what the research on happiness tends

connected life uh are critically
important if you have no money if you're
destitute that that makes you unhappy if
you're diseased that makes you unhappy
but above those minimum requirements uh
having a meaningful life that also is
connected to others turns out to be
fairly critical and when you think about
it um at the moment of your death it
doesn't really matter matter how much
material stuff you leave behind uh when
I was young I was in a very bad

the achievements and all the
material uh items meant absolutely
nothing the thing that I thought last
about were the individuals who I loved

my only concern at that point was really
just with with them and that's something
I think
most people if not everyone goes through
at the end and it's it's you know in
some ways it was a gift for me to

that then that contributes to Greater
happiness as
well human nature is defined variously

in everyday
life I wrote the book for two reasons
and I wrote the book with Bill Patrick
who is a wonderful wonderful uh friend

wrote the book book uh for two reasons
one reason was because I think
loneliness is badly
misunderstood and that's to the
